alert.note: Alert for Carlton, South St. Louis; Central St. Louis; North St. Louis; Northern Aitkin; Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Pine; Southern Cook, North Shore; Southern Lake, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 20 at 11:19AM CST until December 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...North St. Louis, Northern Cook and Lake, Central St. Louis, Southern Lake, Southern Cook, Northern Aitkin, Carlton and South St. Louis and Pine Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Grand Portage Reservation, the Fond du Lac Band, the Mille Lacs Band, Lena Lake, Hinckley and, Big Sandy Lake areas and the Bois Forte Band, Lake Vermilion and, Nett Lake areas. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow loading on trees from the past storm in combination with the high winds may cause heavy tree damage resulting in widespread power outages in cold weather. Blizzard conditions are possible.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
